events.name: SG SQL User Group Meetup - Aug 2015
events.description: In August 2015, we have two more volunteers for the UG event. Agenda:  6:30 pm to 7pm - Arrival/ Registration and Networking. 7pm to 7:45pm - 1st session 15 minute break and networking session. Can be longer if 1st session finishes earlier.  8pm to 9:30pm - 2nd session After 9:30pm, adjourned to Lau Pasat for supper and drinks (each person pay for yourself). TOPIC 1: Using PowerShell with SQL Server Business Intelligence PowerShell is a command-line based scripting language used by IT Professionals to automate system administration tasks in Windows platforms. Either via built in cmdlets or an exposed API (SMO), SQL Server professionals can harness the power of PowerShell and leverage it to their organizations' advantage. In this presentation, you will learn some of the ways you can use PowerShell in SQL Server BI Administration in an enterprise environment. You will acquire practical knowledge to start utilizing PowerShell yourself. Finally, you will be inspired on how simple it is to automate those repetitive administration tasks. About Speaker:  Vanessa Rose Castro is a Regulatory Reports Engineer at ING Bank N.V., Singapore. On her daily job she uses Microsoft SQL Server to deliver Business Intelligence to ING branches across South East Asia. You can find solutions to BI development and administrative problems, as well as book reviews on her space on the internet: http://vaniecastro.com/. TOPIC 2: Transaction Log.The SQL Transaction log is one of the most misunderstood parts of SQL Server in terms of how it works. The presentation would cover the basic terminology, logs architectural and VLF algorithm, a few undocumented commands to scan the log file(s), 3-4 domes to relate things with real time with internal details explanation. Besides these, the presentation would also cover what would be the best way to implement log files considering the number of VLFs.  About speaker:Dharmendra Keshari has strong and in-depth experience in Database Management and its internals. Currently, working as Senior Database Administrator in one of the best Semi-Government organization in Singapore. He is an avid, regular mentor on social media, helping several enthusiast in solving problems related to Database management. He has completed certification for “Microsoft SQL Server® 2008, Implementation” and “Maintenance & Administering Microsoft SQL Server 2012 Database”
events.location: Microsoft Singapore, One Marina Boulevard, Level 22, Meeting Room

events.name: HackerspaceSG Awesome Talks, August 2015
events.description:
For our inaugural edition of Hackerspace Awesome Talks, we are excited to welcome Carter Emmart and Aaron Maniam. 

Carter is the Director of Astrovisualization at the American Museum of Natural History. He is a storyteller, weaving together the knowledge that science uncovers about our universe and the technicalities of visualisation to create immersive experiences. He is also heading up the development of a 3D atlas called The Digital Universe. Sit tight as he takes us on a trip round our universe!

Amongst many things that nourish him, Aaron is poet inspired by the solitude and beauty he finds in nature. He will be reading some of his poems, as well as sharing about his involvement in an anthology of local poetry titled From Walden to Woodlands.

events.description: - The purpose of this study group is for sharing and discussion on JS.  - We do not host any talks or courses. This week, we will carry on with "You Don't Know JS"  and after the discussion, we can start working on our own practical projects.  **Please bring your laptops and try to read up on the following material: Scope & Closures - http://bit.ly/1PeOFoc Please try to read Chapter 3, 4 & 5 for the discussion. **Join our chat channel: #milo-dinosaur on Kopi.JS Slack - http://kopijs.herokuapp.com/
events.location: Hackerspace.SG, 344B King George's Ave, King George's Building, Singapore

events.name: DSSG Aug Meetup - DataRobot
events.description: *Please note that RSVP will only start on Sunday (Aug 16), 1230pm.* This month, we are proud to have Xavier from DataRobot to do a deep dive into data modeling.   Synopsis: Xavier will present the solution he and his colleagues from DataRobot developed to win the 3rd prize at the KDDCup 2015. The competition consisted of predicting dropouts of students of XuetangX, a MOOC platform initiated by Tsinghua University in China. Xavier will describe how he converted students log data into usable features for Machine Learning using counts, simple statistics, entropy, factorization and text mining techniques.  Agenda: • 7.00pm - 7.15pm: Networking • 7.15pm - 8.15pm: Xavier: Featurizing log data for predicting dropouts in MOOC @ KDDCup 2015. • 8.15pm - 8.30pm: Closing and Networking. Xavier Conort is the Chief Data Scientist at DataRobot, a venture-backed predictive analytics software company. Xavier has applied Machine Learning to diverse business problems ranging from churn prediction to claims modeling, flight arrival prediction, essay scoring, sales forecasting, and biological response prediction. To sharpen his skills in Machine Learning, Xavier competes on Kaggle and in KDDCups where he won 10 prizes. Before joining DataRobot, Xavier was principal research engineer in I2R and has an extensive experience in the insurance industry as an actuary in France, Brazil, China and Singapore. • Linkedin: https://www.kaggle.com/xavierconort  • Please note that RSVP will only start on Sunday (Aug 16), 1230pm.
events.location: #03-04, IDA Labs@NDC 111 Middle Road, National Design Centre, Singapore 188969., IDA Labs@NDC 111 Middle Road, National Design Centre

events.name: NoSql night!
events.description: We will be glad to welcome you for a NoSql night. Clarence Tauro from CouchBase will be traveling to Singapore on that week and will be our guest speaker. We have interviewed Clarence here. Abstract NoSQL databases offer a significant change to how enterprise applications are built, challenging to two-decade hegemony of relational databases. The question people face is whether NoSQL databases are an appropriate choice, either for new projects or to introduce to existing projects. This talk will give a rapid introduction to NoSQL databases: where they came from, the nature of the data models they use, and the different way you have to think about consistency and polyglot persistence. It will then dive into Couchbase, which is a high-performance NoSQL distributed database with a flexible data model. Finally it will discuss how to integrate CouchBase with Spring using the Spring Data Couchbase project.  ============================================Note: if you are interested to go for CouchBase training in Singapore, all information is available here:  http://training.couchbase.com/class/for-developers/cd220-developing-couchbase-nosql-applications/singapore-central-singapore/2015a
events.location: PayPal office in Suntec, 5 Temasek Blvd, #09-01 Suntec Tower Five, 038985 Nearest Mrt:Promenade(Yellow Line), Singapore

events.name: ArtScience Late
events.description:
[TICKETS SOLD OUT!] 
Ryoji Ikeda: Supercodex
Thursday 20 August, 8pm
ArtScience Museum, Level 4

http://www.marinabaysands.com/museum/exhibitions-and-events/artscience-late.html  

PREPARE TO BE IMMERSED IN A MULTI-SENSORIAL EXTRAVAGANZA.

ArtScience Museum is thrilled to welcome Japan’s leading electronic composer and visual artist, Ryoji Ikeda, to the museum for one night only.

Sonic artist, visual artist, and composer in one, Ryoji Ikeda has gained international renown for his striking audiovisual artworks. Ikeda's work is deeply rooted in an ongoing investigation of mathematics and science. He uses stunning, immersive visuals, and a distinctive electronic music style to communicate complex topics about the outer limits of science, in a highly accessible way.  

His performance for ArtScience Late, as part of the Sound Islands Festival, is supercodex [live set]. It makes the invisible data that permeates our world tangible and perceivable.  The performance showcases how sound can be turned into data and how data can be turned into sound.  supercodex [live set] draws inspirations from the idea of quantum superposition, a key principle of contemporary physics. It investigates how we understand the reality of nature on an atomic scale through mathematical models and quantum mechanics. supercodex [live set] begins subtly, with digital noise, pure tones and bass drones, and gradually builds into an immersive, textured sensory audiovisual experience.

Don’t miss this unique opportunity to see one of the world's most acclaimed experimental performers, in an extraordinary live event that is bound to be an unforgettable experience. 

Concept, composition: Ryoji Ikeda
Computer graphics, programming: Tomonaga Tokuyama
For more information please visit: http://www.ryojiikeda.com/archive/concerts/#supercodex_live_set

Part of the Soundislands Festival [Logo] 

About Ryoji Ikeda

Hailing from Japan, and based in France, Ryoji Ikeda focuses on the essential characteristics of sound, light and mathematics. He has gained a reputation as one of the few international artists working convincingly across both visual and sonic media. He elaborately orchestrates sound, visuals, materials, physical phenomena and mathematical notions into immersive live performances and installations.
He has performed and exhibited worldwide in the Museum of Contemporary Art Tokyo, MoMA New York, Tate Modern in London, Ars Electronica Center Linz, Elektra Festival Montreal, Sonar Festival Barcelona, Aichi Triennale Nagoya, Palazzo Grassi Venice, Park Avenue Armory New York, Museo de Arte Bogota, Hamburger Bahnhof Berlin, Sharjah Biennale, Auckland Triennale, MONA Museum Hobart, Telefonica Foundation Madrid, and many other locations.

He has recently been touring his new performance, superposition, in major venues such as Centre Pompidou in Paris, Barbican Center in London, Kyoto Experiment in Japan, Concertgebouw Brugge and Amsterdam, Metropolitan Museum in New York, Walker Art Center in Minneapolis, and Center for the Arts of Performance UCLA in Los Angeles. His large scale light and sound installation, spectra, was recently presented in Hobart, Australia, Sharjah, UAE, and London as part of First World War Centenary Art Commissions.

His musical recordings and albums +/- (1996), 0°C (1998), matrix (2000), dataplex (2005), test pattern (2008) and supercodex (2013) pioneered a new minimal world of electronic music through his razor-sharp techniques and aesthetics. 

He is the award winner of the Prix Ars Electronica Collide@CERN 2014.  In 2015, he will present solo exhibitions at The Vinyl Factory London, ZKM Karlsruhe and Kumu Museum Tallinn among others.

For more information: www.ryojiikeda.com

events.name: Friday Hacks #94: Welcome Tea & The Creation of NUSWhispers
events.description:
Friday Hacks are back for this new academic year! 

Please join us in our Welcome Tea, where our president will share about what we do, the importance of fostering hacker culture in NUS and how to hack life!

The folks behind the popular NUSWhispers, Yang Shun, Erin, Yichen & Melvin will then reveal the story behind NUSWhispers, NUS's largest anonymous sharing portal with over 15,000 active users!

All freshmen & current students from all faculties are welcome to attend. As always, free pizza starts at 6.30pm ;)

Read on to get a quick idea of what we do:
NUS Hackers is a student-run organization committed to the spread of hacker culture & free/open-source software. We provide a support system for hackers in NUS who are currently building things (be it for charity, business or pleasure). We also hold workshops, organizer weekly meet-ups, run hackathons, and maintain open source code for the NUS community.
events.location: Seminar Room 1, School of Computing, National University of Singapore

events.description:
Groove to the beats of traditional Asian rhythms interspersed with electronic dance music. The NUS Electronic Music Lab, a multi-genre music collective, will close the night on a musical high with their experimental take on Peranakan music.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

The NUS Electronic Music Lab (EML) is a performing arts group that creates, produces, remixes, performs, records and promotes original electronic music. It is based at the Centre For the Arts in the National University of Singapore.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Set times:
22 Aug (Day 1): Ocean's Children
23 Aug (Day 2): The Kids with Laptops (Kester, Skysprinter, nanowander)

29 Aug (Day 3): Ocean's Children
30 Aug (Day 4): Mitch Advent, David Phoon & a combined EML set

Expect every set to be different, so please come down to watch all 4 sets =)

The gig will be happening on the stage at Armenian Street opposite the Peranakan Museum.

events.name: Conversations: “~sound:senses”
events.description:
“~sound:senses” 

Saturday 22nd August 2015
2.30pm to 5.30pm
ArtScience Museum, Level 4
FREE

What is the colour of sound? Does the shape of the plate change the taste of the cake?  This August, join us as leading artists and scientists in the fields of psychology, sound art, perception, and multimodal design come together to explore how sound acts as the glue connecting our sensorial experiences and interactions. Guest speakers include luminaries such as interaction designer, Stefania Serafin, crossmodality researcher Charles Spence, composer Joyce Beetuan Koh, filmmaker Daniel Belton, and psycholinguist Suzy Styles. Chairing the panel is ArtScience Museum Executive Director, Honor Harger. The event will close with a special performance by CLUBbleu who will showcase their signature sounds of electro-acoustics, deep drones and broken blast beats.

The event is part of the Soundislands Festival, initiated by PerMagnus Lindborg with support from CLASS and ADM at Nanyang Technological University, the Italian Institute of Culture, and the Arts Council of New Zealand.

events.name: Sunday Showcase
events.description:
Sunday Showcase allows visitors unique access to cutting edge projects being undertaken by different tertiary institutions across Singapore. The series invites the creators and their work into ArtScience Museum on a Sunday each month. The creators are on hand throughout the afternoon to talk with visitors about their inventions, their creative process, and to facilitate visitors' interaction with the projects. There is something for everyone in this hands-on, accessible showcase series.

Sunday 23rd August 2015
10am to 6.30pm
ArtScience Museum, Level 4
FREE

“~sound:senses” 

Sound is the medium that acts as the glue between the senses, intertwining hearing, vision and movement. This Sunday Showcase, we invite you to dive into a coral reef of artworks and scientific demonstrations by international artists and researchers who have mapped out crossmodal associations with touch, smell, feel, and taste. “~sound:senses” will feature sound installations, experimental films, robotic sculptures, mobile media, web audio solutions, as well as workshops on electroacoustic sounds led by experts. 

The event is part of the Soundislands Festival, with support from Nanyang Technological University.

events.name: Megaport SDN Connect
events.description: Come and meet the local Megaport team, network with industry leaders and learn about Megaport's award winning SDN based elastic interconnection fabric.  Paul Laverty, Greater Asia Lead from Microsoft Azure ExpressRoute will also be joining us to talk about Microsoft Azure and the strategic importance for why businesses are leaning in through consuming cloud services, the investment Microsoft is making and what Azure ExpressRoute is and why it is important.   About Megaport  Need 10 Gbps for an hour?  Scale massive bandwidth when you need it and turn it down when you don't. With Megaport it's that simple.  Provision up to 100 Gbps across multiple markets and into cloud services instantly. Gone are the days of just in time. With Megaport you get access to scalable bandwidth across multiple markets, networks, and cloud services in real time.  We're an SDN based ethernet network solution built by developers. Our restful API and developer community unlocks endless possibilities for you to use our network how you want it. You have the ideas, Megaport has the platform.
events.location: Club Meatballs, 20 Cross Street, #01-34,China Square Central, Singapore

events.name: Virtual Reality for Retail and Advertising
events.description:
It is evident that Virtual Reality is going to revolutionise a number of industries. This time we  will be discussing how we going to apply Virtual Reality technology to Advertising and Virtual Retail. Imagine the possibility of setting up storefront just like how we create websites like html now. So as, hire a virtual shopkeeper for your virtual storefront. Imagine the possibility to curate a virtual building of all the rooms, just like orchard road. Each room is a virtual shop in the building. Imagine the possibility to bring your possible customer to place or experience that you want them to experience to advertise your product. Such as taking your customer to taste a glimpse of Japan before showing them the Japan tour package. The $22tn retail industry is for us, the Virtual Reality Enthusiast to explore and set pace. Being able to simulate the real shopping experience whilst in the comfort of their own home is another big step from the present online shopping experiences.  And for marketers looking to VR / AR as a way of delivering richer brand experiences, we’ll look at examples from Nissan, Castrol, Marriott Hotels, Dior and Patron. So let discuss and share about what can we, the VR Enthusiast brings to this market. We would also be having a speaker to share about : •  How agencies and brands are starting to apply VR / AR technologies to their advertising and marketing efforts - Don Anderson, Regional Managing Director, We Are Socia @whateyeread •  MetaRoom markup for VR website - Jia Hen, CEO of VRcollab @wizztjh 



Agenda 7.00 pm - Networking/ interesting VR video or link sharing/ Introduction 7.30 pm - Speaker's talk 8.30 pm - Networking

events.name: Double Bill !! Dependency Injection + Streaming File Uploads with Spray.io
events.description: Yes it's that time again and we have 2 full talks of back to back Scala awesomeness crammed in... Talk 1: Overview of dependency injection methods in Scala.  I'll try to compare them and give brief intro. Currently I'm planning to cover:  • Cake Pattern • Reader Monad • MacWire  • Maybe some others + mention older Java ways.  Time is limited so I can't go into deep details on each one but I'll try to cover the most interesting parts. I'll drop a link to the code when ready. Speaker: Alexis  Talk A:  Handling large file uploads in Spray.io   When using Spray.io as the back-end for your service, special care must be taken in handling large file uploads such as mp3 and movie files. In this talk we are going to discuss the motivation, means as well as the current implementation shortcomings that the programmer must face. Speaker: Ganesh

events.name: Introduction to Automation with Selenium
events.description: Please register here... Hands on Test automation series We are happy to invite you to the second edition of vodQA on Saturday August 29th, 2015 at the ThoughtWorks Singapore office. vodQA (Value Oriented Discussion for Quality Analysts), a forum where testing enthusiasts get together, network and collaborate on the latest developments in the world of software testing. So far, we have successfully hosted more than 20 editions of vodQA across all ThoughtWorks India offices. And now, the most successful testing un-conference is making its debut in Singapore. Introduction to Automation with Selenium This workshop is intended to impart a basic knowledge of Automation and Selenium. A robust hands-on experience setting up Selenium, simple tests, sessions on debugging tests and executing them will be the key takeaways. This edition is going to be an interactive workshop where you will get selenium exposure from basics to hands-on. This vodQA aims at getting you up-to-speed on how to start using Selenium. NOTE: Registration is free for all and food will be provided. Please bring your own laptops for the event. *Limited seats -  Confirmation of attendance will be sent by separate email shortly.  Please register here...
events.location: ThoughtWorks office, 87B Amoy Street, Level 3, Singapore

events.name: Rails Girls Meetup (August)
events.description: How is everyone feeling after RDRC? As we approach the third-quarter of the year, it's time to start consolidating and practising what we've learnt! As usual, we will have a structured workshop syllabus to facilitate learning for the beginners. For those who have been attending our meetups regularly and/or know the basics of Ruby on Rails, our flexibility will still be there. If you'd like to work on your project or run through concepts/material with guidance, our coaches are more than happy to help and answer your questions. We love the enthusiasts!  Come and join us at the August Rails Girls meetup! Agenda: • 10:00 - 10:15   Registration • 10:15 - 10:20   Introduction • 10:20 - 10:30  Break into groups • 10:30 - 13:00  Start to code  ---------- FAQs ---------- I haven't attended any previous Rails Girls events. Can I still join in this one? Absolutely! We can help you start with the Rails Girls app if you did not attend the last workshop. What should I bring? A working laptop and power supply. Is this free? Yes! But we are not providing any food/coffee. Can I come if I'm not a woman? Rails Girls is designed for women and anyone who self-identifies as a woman. Men are most welcomed as a participant's +1 . Is there an age limit? Nope! Event is full! What should I do? Join the waitlist! We'll let you know when a new slot becomes available. Also, please update your RVSP if your plans have changed. Someone will really appreciate your slot. :) I'm a professional Rails Developer, can I be a coach? Yes, we are always looking for Ruby/Rails experts to help! Please contact Nathania (nathaniawong89@gmail.com) and DO NOT RSVP to this event. Confirmed coaches: - Sherwyn - Ted - Sai - Aravindh - Lachlan - Tania Can my company sponsor Rails Girls meetup? Thank you for helping us build an awesome community! If your company would like to sponsor this meetup, please get in touch with Winston (winston.yongwei@gmail.com).

events.name: Come watch the live Ace of Coders finals
events.description: Hi everyone. More than 450 Singaporean students are practicing their python skills this month as part of the IDA Ace of Coders online qualification. If you know any secondary school students or JC students in Singapore, please encourage them to participate. The top 10 schools in each category will get to attend the live event at Suntec City on September 10th and compete for over $9000 in cash prizes.  You can mark your calendar now and plan to come watch some of the best school-aged python developers in Singapore complete in a DOTA2-style Code Combat arena. You can also checkout the latest school rankingsto see how the schools you are most interested in are doing.
events.location: Suntec City Mall, 3 Temasek boulevard #03-027E/F Suntec City Mall, Singapore, Singapore 038983

events.name: ArtScience Late
events.description:
Gazelle Twin and Special Guests
10 Sep, Thu, 7pm to 10pm
Expression Gallery, Level 4
FREE

This ArtScience Late, for the first time in Asia, FutureEverything Singapore will present unique performances from UK artist Gazelle Twin, and new Singaporean music and audio visual talents.

 Fresh from their appearance at 2015 FutureEverything Festival in Manchester, standout British artist, composer and producer Elizabeth Bernholz will perform as her alter ego, Gazelle Twin.  Performing works from her seminal album, ‘Unflesh’, this evening promises to be highly visual with challenging visions of “horror-pop”.

Joining Gazelle Twin will be a carefully curated selection of audio visual and electronic artists from Singapore to present an evening of the most innovative and imaginative breaking sounds from the UK and Singapore underground.

FutureEverything Singapore is a partnership between FutureEverything and Singapore's Infocomm Development Authority (IDA), one of the key government agencies championing Singapore’s efforts to become the world’s first Smart Nation. IDA is the organiser of the umbrella programme, the Festival of Tech (www.festivaloftech.sg).

events.name: Investment Trends in Southeast Asia -- How Investors Look at the Region? by @Justin Hall
events.description:
This session is intended to help attendees understand how investors look at potential investments and close deals. It'll not only cover broad investment trends in Singapore and Southeast Asia, but will also help entrepreneurs understand such complex issues like determining when to raise, understanding key terms on a term sheet, and how to pitch to investors. 

Justin Hall is Principal at Golden Gate Ventures, an early-stage venture capital fund based in Singapore but investing across Southeast Asia, Taiwan, and Hong Kong. 

As principal, he manages Golden Gate Ventures' existing portfolio while sourcing investments across APAC. In addition, he is director for Golden Gate Ventures Annex Fund, focused on follow-on funding for existing portfolio companies.

IMPORTANT NOTES FOR ATTENDEES:

* Lunch is sponsored by Golden Gate Ventures for this Hackers & Painters session

* Venue sponsor: NUS Enterprise as usual! :-)

* NUS Enterprise/Plugin has moved to #02-09, so look for the new space right by the stair case on Level 2, Blk 71!  Do not go to the old location at #02-18

See you!

events.name: Azure and SGDotNET User Group Meeting @ 11th Sep 2015 7:00pm
events.description: Details coming soon
events.location: Microsoft Singapore, One Marina Boulevard, Level 22, Meeting Room

events.name: The PowerShell Conference 2015, Asia
events.description:
PowerShell Conference Asia 2015 is coming up fast so here’s a quick update on all the incredible speakers we’ve got lined up already.  After we sent out the call for Speakers and Sponsors we had an awesome response. We’ve had Community Members, MVPs and even the PowerShell Product Team put their hand up to be there and present the latest and greatest in PowerShell to you.  Now that we’re rapidly approaching the second half of the year a lot of people have been contacting us keen to know how they can register. We’ve been really overwhelmed with interest and support from the whole APAC Community, so thank you for that.  Here’s an overview of the current arrangements and plans 


Platinum Sponsor We are extremely pleased to announce officially that SAPIEN Technologies are going to be our platinum sponsor for this event! SAPIEN have long supported the PowerShell community and make some of the best tools on the market. With amazing folks like David Corales, Ferdinand Rios and June Blender, SAPIEN are hugely influential in the PowerShell community, we can't thank them enough for helping to make this event happen. SAPIEN will be present for both days and we look forward to welcoming them. If you can arrange to stay an extra day you’ll be able to experience the excitement of the Singapore F1 Grand Prix. What a way to wrap up the week!  What about Registration? Registration: We have opened up Registration on EventBrite and you can find it here: https://www.eventbrite.sg/e/powershell-conference-asia-2015-tickets-17336891108 

We are accepting payment by PayPal and registration is not confirmed until payment is made. For this awesome event we are asking a US$200 registration fee. So what do you get for your money? • 2 full days of intense sessions with international speakers • Breakfast, lunch and afternoon tea on both days • T-Shirt and sponsor giveaways • Entry to the Closing Party on Saturday evening (food & drinks included) • Connect with other PowerShell enthusiasts in the region • Network with peers, MVPs, speakers and the PowerShell Team! 


If you have any questions or need help arranging travel and accommodation details please let us know. We’re really excited to see you all there in September. **DISCLAIMER**: By registering through MeetUp is just an indicative on knowing which peers will be attending within the group which will be beneficial to learn together. You will need to register through EventBrite and have the confirmation email before you are allow in the event! Lastly, we have limited seats! So do hurry up!
events.location: Microsoft Auditorium (Singapore), One Marina Boulevard, Level 21 Auditorium, Singapore 018989

events.name: Front End TL;DR September 2015
events.description:
In September the event will take place at the offices of Viki, one of Singapore's most famous startups.

Address: CapitaGreen, 138 Market Street, 048946 Singapore

Join to level-up your front-end knowledge, meet other front-end developers, or learn how other engineers ship code.

7:00pm — Arrival, seating, food & drinks
7:15pm — Intro talk by the host
7:30pm — R&D: random team assignment, choose a topic, learn something new
9:00pm — Q&A: share what your team learned
9:30pm — The end.

Every third Monday of the month. Different venue each time. Bring ID and a laptop. Arrive earlier to get set up with wifi and food.

events.name: A look at Ways To Monetize Your 3D Printing Hobby
events.description: Wondering how to get started on your 3D printing?  Maybe you have started on a 3D model and making your first 3D printed products, but you haven't got a clue how to make money from it?  Hear from our guest artists who will share with you their practical tips and experiences! Join us for a few hours of 3D printing and scanning over some finger food too.  Sign up early - we can only take about 20 people.  See you folks!
